website_summaries.verdict: The best budget power supply capable of handling lighter gaming rigs running with budget or mid-range components.
pros: Power supply runs cool under normal operating conditions or with games using low-to-medium settings
The fan runs more quietly than premium power supplies
cons: The power supply can suddenly drop power, resetting the computer during gameplay

customer_reviews.title: Quality PSU for the price
customer_reviews.text: Dont just trust Amazon/Newegg reviews when it comes to PSU's. Many Power supplies have underlying issues most users dont know about because many people just assume if it turns on, it's good. Sites like Tom's Hardware, Jonnyguru and GamersNexus "benchmark" PSU's to see how safe they really are for your system. Your PSU is literally the heart of your system (it delivers power to everything like blood does.) You wouldnt buy a heart for your body without doing research if it's truly any good, would you?
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Got the wrong psu, and it was broken
customer_reviews.text: I am livid. I paid for a 550 watt modular corsair psu, and I get a 600 watt non-modular coolermaster psu that doesnt even work. It even came in the CX550M corsair box.
customer_reviews.author: John Gardner

customer_reviews.title: fail
customer_reviews.text: Was building a "gaming" PC with the kid, finally got the PC built up and installed the OS. the zoink--the PC just shut off. Would just power off completely and restart. alrighty then, i guess i will look to see what the issue is.... Did all the troubleshooting i could think of, swapped memory, checked temps, checked OS logs (no logs as it just powers off). Finally said screw it and tried another spare power supply i had---it stayed up and stable. never shutdown. Amazon was nice enough to return it after the regular return date passed (spent a couple weeks trying to get it to work). Going with a different PS. not chancing this mess again.
customer_reviews.author: Cleatus

customer_reviews.title: Worked/Dead Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for one day. Went to work, came back and no power. Notice a distinct smell coming from the unit. I replaced it with an EVGA SuperNOVA G2 and the computer booted right up. Once I started reading the 1 star reviews i noticed a trend. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: pbjohnson

customer_reviews.title: It Works (.)
customer_reviews.text: Swapped out an ailing CX430 (non-modular) for this CX450. It seems my nerd days are over. I'm old now. So it took several hours of checking/double checking/cross checking before the swap. I’ve been smitten before by companies that ship products with mismatched parts, missing cables, etc. This product from Corsair was exactly as described Everything worked out great. Goodbye to my old PSU with its noisy power surges!
customer_reviews.author: Carl Truth

customer_reviews.title: One star for each day it worked
customer_reviews.text: One star for each full day of operation I got out of it. Running an i7-4790 with a 1080Ti, it had some pretty bad coil whine/ buzzing out of the box, figured maybe it'd resolve itself eventually. Left it idling and came back a few hours later and it was off. Would only spin the fans but wouldn't POST, replaced it with an RM750x and the computer is working fine. Honestly I expected better for an 80+ Bronze PSU, even the crappy Thermaltake PSU that this was replacing lasted 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Eric D. Schubert

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete and therefore netiquette
customer_reviews.text: After frustrating months of getting all my tek savvy friends to help, we finally find that this power supply is the reason my computer keeps shutting down. It has every cable included but one cable to the motherboard and for that reason the motherboard is overheating. There is a port clearly labeled for it but it just DOES NOT INCLUDE THE NECESSARY CABLE! The manufacturer also did not have it. The cord is nearly impossible to find, even online. It was way more frustration and hasle than it was worth.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: a decent PSU, but I wish I got a better one.
customer_reviews.text: enough wattage for my system, isn't loud at all, but once in a while I'll get weird little power issues which cause my computer to hang up in a way that requires me to hard reset it. not enough of a pain for me to RMA it (don't want to wait days if not weeks for a replacement while not being able to use my computer) but I'll probably go for a little higher quality for the next time I buy a power supply. at least it has a pretty long warranty so if it fails outright, I can get a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Kim

customer_reviews.title: Its been like a month and 8 days since i bought this ...
customer_reviews.text: Its been like a month and 8 days since i bought this item, and it already blew out, i am not satisfied with the product, I was in the middle of a Rocket league game and all of sudden *POP* dead psu, sounded like something popped, scared me to death.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Flores

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed is an understatement.
customer_reviews.text: Three months after purchase I am getting coil whine and what can only be described as random power spikes from the PSU. Outside the return window for Amazon, and not worth the hassle of RMA with Corsair. Disappointed is an understatement. I had high hopes, and no worries when ordering a Corsair product because all others have performed flawlessly in the past.
customer_reviews.author: J.Wainscott

customer_reviews.title: Buy a different brand
customer_reviews.text: **UPDATE: Damage claim dept finally contacted me about the claim process** DO NOT BUY FROM THIS COMPANY. This was running fine, then upon starting one day after only being installed less than 1 week, it blew fire and smoke and fried all the components of my computer. I have contacted customer service and technical support multiple times about my damage claim they supposedly filed, and no one will contact me back. Due to the faulty power supply they are liable for damaging my whole computer and they won't respond.
customer_reviews.author: Matt & Madison

customer_reviews.title: Works fine
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work perfectly so far, I've never really used anything other than Antec. Antec use to be the the power supply every serious computer user had, so this brand is new for me. The only con I have is the SATA cables. I had to do some serious acrobatics just to plug in a hard drive and dvd drive. The cables seemed to have some design flaw that required me to almost twist the cable around in a loop just to plug it in. I removed one star for that. I'm happy otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: MikeFrett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for the Alienware Graphics Amplifier
customer_reviews.text: For my fellow AGA owners, this is your replacement series of Power Supply. It is an exact fit and requires no modification to the power socket area on the amp. One thing to note, you will need to put the switch in the ON position prior to installation as it will not be accessible without modification to the Amplifier. The cable lengths are fine and can be easily managed inside the Amplifier's volume. The 8pin ATX 12V power connector will not be used and you will only need a single PCIe modular lead. This is a great replacement for the OEM Dell power supply whose fan failed on my Graphics Amplifier.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Evil

customer_reviews.title: THE CX model's Are Cheap Crap
customer_reviews.text: Bought the CX 750, because I'm dumb and didn't do any research. Ended up with a cheap psu, when I really wanted the RM750x model, which is a way nicer product. A little annoyed at amazon as both the CX/RM psu' share the same reviews. so I thought ppl liked so I got one. The psu works and powers on but the fan won't spin when my pc is upright, it's getting caught/stopped by something. If you need a PSU spend the extra money and GET THE RMx SERIES, Do NOT BUY THE CHEAP ASS CX SERIES
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Good But Not A Reliable PSU
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product new for a pc I was building for a customer. Don't usually use this brand, but to the customers request, got this one. When I initially installed it, everything was fine, little to no noise, good power and I was quite impressed. Didn't last long however. Customer came back a little after a month stating that pc wasn't turning on anymore. They didn't know what the issue was. Checked all the basics, then went to the power supply, tested it, and no power whatsoever. Brand new psu, failed within a 2 month period. Would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Corey G.

customer_reviews.title: Silent and cool even while gaming.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this PSU for my gaming pc, and I love it. All of the cables are plenty long enough for my mid tower. The semi modular feature is great too. You only need to plug in the cables you need so there is not a huge mess of unused wiring all over inside the case. I am currently powering an AMD FX 8320 CPU, Asus Dual GTX 1060 6GB GPU, 16GB Corsair Vengeance RAM, two 7200 rpm 3.5" HDD's, one SSD, five 140mm upHere RGB143-5 case fans, and four 120mm upHere RGB123-5. I have been running it for a few days now and have not had any problems with it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Great power and performance
customer_reviews.text: The CORSAIR CX Series (CX650) 650 Watt 80 Plus Bronze Power Supply delivers great power and performance at a reasonable price range. The fan has a good amount of ventilation and fan speed. It's not the quietest power supply on the market, but it is quiet and very reasonable. At 650 watts, it offers a great amount of power for most users. Some builders might need more depending on their build, but always checking power requirements. It's not modular, but I didn't expect it to be in this range. Corsair has a great name and this power supply certainly lives up to it.
customer_reviews.author: midnight122

customer_reviews.title: Good PSU for a good price when on sale.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a bit more headroom for newer more powerful video card. This 650 watt semi modular was perfect. Won't buy another non-semi-modular, and I won't buy too much psu ever again. Had a large 750 non-modular in the past on a different machine. It was overkill, and trying to hide all those non-modular wires that weren't being used was a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Mark_S

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 months before completely giving up
customer_reviews.text: I retrieved the product in a partially opened package, I plugged it in and turned it on and it worked fine. Woke up one morning to game, launched my game, played for about 30 minutes and computer just completely shut off. I TRIED EVERYTHING you can imagine until I finally figured out this very bad PSU was the problem, this product definitely is not worth it and should be taken down and be no longer available for purchase
customer_reviews.author: Tierra Dye

customer_reviews.title: Power supply causing PC to reboot continuously.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this brand new for a new build. It The PC booted up fine but when going to Install OS system about half way the PC would shut down and reboot itself OVER, and OVER again. I didn't want to believe it was the PSU given the fact that this is the second time I've bought this model thinking the other one was bad. Don't recommend this corsair PSU. SMH. Such a great company with something bad as this. This PSU should of had more than enough power to power everything in the RIG.
customer_reviews.author: Phannasone

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic PSU, great price
customer_reviews.text: Finished a pc buikd for my lady with this bad boy and it has been working wonderfully. We didn't do the clear case with the lights bells and whistles vuild but the braided cables and modular system would've made that a breeze. As it is cable management was a snap and because its modular we dont havr a rats nest of extra wires jamming up the place. Now as I upgrade my pc, I've just learned I'll need a new PSU to feed my Christmas graphics card; buying another one of these for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Great overall package, could use some small improvements.
customer_reviews.text: It's overall a good value for the money, at 69.99 for a one of the few lower watt/bronze model PSUs with high quality materials and protections in place (ie; not EVGA B unit styled junk) but I do have some complaints Firstly, while it is modular, you are stuck with a single 2x 6+2 PCIe, so if your GPU just needs a 6 or 8 pin, expect the other to just dangle there. Be wary of layman PSUs complaining about their unit dying when it probably died to protect their miswired and mismanaged PC, whereas a lesser unit would have fried something on the way out.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Convenient power unit
customer_reviews.text: I have an old gaming PC from years ago that never had the right PSU installed, but since I was on a budget, I couldn't afford to replace it. Flash forward to a few months ago and the PSU died, as I predicted it would, blacking out my entire system. I bought this Corsair model as a replacement on a recommendation from a tech rep and couldn't be more pleased. It was incredibly easy to install (essentially plug-and-play) and like most Corsair products, really seems of high-quality. Fit into my case conveniently and made cord management a breeze. Powers on without an issue and makes no abrasive noise whatsoever. Definitely recommend this to others!
customer_reviews.author: The Boldest Squid

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Dead on arrival. will update after the replacement arrives. I bought this to replace a failed cooler master rather than wait for the RMA. sometimes the bad luck just piles up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and very quiet when running. I like the hybrid cable design, works very well for me.
customer_reviews.text: This is so quiet I doubt if the fan ever turns on, I replaced my HP 300-watt unit which was failing with this 450 watt and it fits perfect and is so much quieter than the HP. I bought this for the fact that it was quiet and made with higher quality parts and has a 5 year warranty. Seriously quiet. Needed to order a special adapter due to HP proprietary cabling. Only $10, no biggie. Save you money on other things buy good quality power supplies such as Corsair.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, cool & elegant.
customer_reviews.text: Important notice : this psu is for bottom psu assembly. The power cables for the drives probably won't reach more then 2 divices if you mount it in an upper psu assembly. All & all, it's a great psu at an affordable price. Though it is not modular and hence, is more challenging from cable management point of view (like most of the similar products in the category), it was easy to install. The psu runs quietly and seems to hibernate with the rest of the computer's components. This allows the system to stay cool when ideal. The cable are black and seems more elegant than colorful cables in other units, though they could have been a bit more flexible.
customer_reviews.author: Gal

customer_reviews.title: Love this Power Unit
customer_reviews.text: I read good reviews on this product and so bought it to replace a different unit that was failing for my PC. No regrets! I liked the aesthetics of the black housing with black cable sleeving and connectors. This power supply stays cool with a very efficient fan, and HUGE bonus is that it is so quiet you have to check to see if it is even running! For reasons I am not going into, I have the tower on my desktop. Keeping it quiet and cool is very important. I was very impressed with the Corsair. Would I buy it again? Absolutely!
customer_reviews.author: Elad

customer_reviews.title: So far so Good
customer_reviews.text: Built my computer back in 2015 and my original PSU kicked the bucket around the end of September and beginning of October. It took a while for me and a few friends to figure out what had happened. Long story short, it was the power supply. I live in an area that has a lot of random power surges and power outages so I'm surprised my original lasted this long. Anyhow, the new PSU is working out Great!! It's a lower wattage than what I had before but it's the some brand I had before too. Corsair is pretty Good to go with.
customer_reviews.author: RedBobbin

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, great size, and sleek design!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, was contemplating using my old 450w on my new build, but surely happy I got this PSU. This thing is super quiet, even after playing for a few hours continuously, not a drop of high fan ramping BUT It is brand new and it's my first day using it so will update in a week to give a more accurate response. Overall however, great PSU for the price! I do wish the cables were a little less stiff out the box though. It may be hard to bend the wires for certain cases of cable management ambitions.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Duhe

customer_reviews.title: Corsair isn't the same anymore - don't count on warranties
customer_reviews.text: Been using corsair for well over 10 years and over that time I purchased tens of thousands of dollars of corsair equipment. Owned my own computer store and sold hundreds of custom rigs with corsair power supplies, cases, watercoolers, ram, etc. All thats over now since they wouldn't honor a warranty on a H115i with a 5 year warranty when the pump failed 2.5 years in. First they told me to "shake it" (the pump is dead dead), so when that didnt work they refused to replace it. Other reviewers are right that they aren't the same company anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Works for 45 minutes and then QUITS!
customer_reviews.text: Had this for about 1 week. Seemed to work fine out of the box. Noticed a random reboot. Thought nothing of it. Next day it happens again twice. I started googling "random restarts" Remember that I never got a blue screen. This means hardware failure. Culprit? Last change was PSU
customer_reviews.author: Northeast USA

customer_reviews.title: It actually fits into small cases!
customer_reviews.text: This actually fits the tiny mini-ITX cases that say they fit "standard ATX powersupplies" but only have 150mm room. I went through two other EVGA power supplies, both listed as supposedly restricting dimensions to the 150mm limitation, and neither of them actually did. This one does. Runs a GTX 1080, Ryzen 7 2700X just fine, just fine.
customer_reviews.author: MedCityMoto

customer_reviews.title: Horrible market smell when running, other than that good.
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my vintage Pentium III machine. Works well. Standard ATX so it fits in the ancient beige case. The only negative, which is quite significant is an absolutely awful marker smell when it's running. Ive used it for many hours and it still hasn't gone away. And for the record, no this smell did not come from the PC before I installed this particular PSU.
customer_reviews.author: Culbrelai

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, but definitely not silent.
customer_reviews.text: A good PSU which I used in a custom firewall appliance. I am a fan of Corsair and this is a well made, inexpensive unit. Knocking off one star because the fan doesn't fall to a slow enough speed to be silent when the computer is not under load. The sound is certainly tolerable, but it has returned my office to having constant white-noise where before it was completely silent despite my high-end desktop, which only make noise when I am playing games (and that noise level is rarely more than the firewall).
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence or Christine Dol

customer_reviews.title: Corsair, only corsair
customer_reviews.text: I will only run corsair psu's in my builds. Too reliable. That said, wish i had the money for semi modular at least. But was able to hide all the non used cables in the cooler master nr600 case. So far this has been enough wattage, no issues. its quiet.
customer_reviews.author: lionlam

customer_reviews.title: Haven't really heard it or thought about it since installing, that is a good thing
customer_reviews.text: I decided to swap out my old 400w PS for this 550w Bronze unit since I upgraded my GPU. It was an effortless installation and it has performed perfectly. It is quiet, delivers all the power my system needs(i5, RX580, 2 -1TB drives, 1 500gb SSD, DVD, WIFI, USB3.0...) I probably could have powered the GPU with my old ps but it was an LG and several yrs old. This ps runs cool and quiet, I could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Nice Fit
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time replacing a power source on a computer I built several years ago. This device came with a bunch of different connectors, pretty good instructions, and was fairly easy to install. Keep in mind, I am a senior citizen with limited computer experience, but this was a breeze. The computer is back to normal and running well. It provides a bit more power than the original source, so that was a plus, too!
customer_reviews.author: Minnie I.

customer_reviews.title: Fits Dell XPS 8300
customer_reviews.text: Lots of power supplies out there. The problem is finding one that fits the Dell XPS 8300 case. The Corsair CX 650 fit perfectly with power leads to spare. The only trick is the 8 pin CPU2 connector splits in half to fit the 4 pin connector on the Dell board. You may have to remove the memory to get at the main CPU connector, or pull the disks. Still only took a few minutes to make the swap.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Customer

customer_reviews.title: A terrible PSU for anybody with a high tier budget
customer_reviews.text: Don't believe the 750W, this thing can't power your computer to its fullest potential. Random restarts started happening, and it's a common issue with this specific unit. Stay away. Also, don't underestimate a good power supply, just because there aren't "benchmarks" comparing units, this thing will affect your GPU, OS, and any peripherals such as phone charging cables, AIO coolers, 5+ fans. Switched to a Seasonic 750W Gold and my computer has never ran this stable. Full throttle fans, charging, audio mixing, powering 2xPG279qs.
customer_reviews.author: xsbs

customer_reviews.title: Cosair customer service was excellent at helping me figure out the connections to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Quiet isn't even the word. Totally silent even with the PC cover off. At first I though it was broken and not even on because it makes no noise but then I saw the fan running and the PC turned on. Cosair customer service was excellent at helping me figure out the connections to the motherboard because there isn't much in the way of documentation. I did need a 24 pin to 14 pin adapter for my Lenovo PC, but that was $8 and worked perfectly. On top of all that, it came in 1 day instead of the usual Prime 2. Thanks Amazon, the noise from my dying power supply was really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L.

customer_reviews.title: Good power supply for the price
customer_reviews.text: I used this PS in a new music production computer that I just built. Used a Ryzen 3 CPU and an SSD hard drive. This appears to be a good poser supply for the price. Works great and was easy to install. The power cables were of ample length which is sometimes an issue with other power supplies. If I needed a similar sized power supply in the future I would buy again. Haven't used it long enough to find any Cons, and don't expect to. It has a good warranty as well.
customer_reviews.author: BurtB

customer_reviews.title: Corsair 750 Modular PSU is very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have built many computers over the last 20 years and this modular 750W PSU from Corsair is well built and lets you manage the cables you need for a cleaner, more efficient look, and better airflow. I have never had a problem with Corsair and like their PSU build quality and the fact that this one is 80% bronze efficient. Great price and very happy with this PSU.
customer_reviews.author: D McDaniel

customer_reviews.title: More Than Good Enough
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what all the negative reviews are about, but this thing works perfectly for me. I really appreciate the semi-modular design and 550w is plenty for a gaming rig without overclocking. Here's what mine is powering: Ryzen 5 3600 MSI RX 5700 ASRock B450M There's not much more to say. Just make sure you don't overpay right now with PSU shortage going on
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Allen

customer_reviews.title: Alternative to Dell OEM 460W PSU
customer_reviews.text: After tedious searching online I was suggested that this PSU would fit my Dell Inspiron 5675 case, and it does. Dell only offers 460w PSU for most of their OEM gaming desktop, which is barely enough (if you don't do any power hungry upgrade later on). So far so good, it fits. I'll give a product rate later on when I used it for some times.
customer_reviews.author: Hao Wang

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. Mine came broken, with a capacitor broken in the main compartment. Couldn't figure it out until I looked inside because my computer would just randomly crash. Then I made a support ticket. The only support I got was after 4 days of waiting, I gave them the invoice and serial number and I still haven't heard from them. It's been a week. I made a Reddit post about it, and got a generic response from a mod. Called and got no help. I'm not buying from Corsair again, ever.
customer_reviews.author: Gage Collier

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in my ryzen 3600x build. It worked fine at first but after a few days i would notice my system power off randomly. At first it was maybe once per day, then became more frequent powering off nearly once per hour. I did lots of troubleshooting and eventually ended up swapping out the PSU. Problem solved. Spend a few more dollars and get something quality that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Kaden Strole

customer_reviews.title: DOA (Dead on arrival)
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping to update my 7 year old PSU after having finally updated the rest of my rig, but upon arrival I mount it and test in in my new rig and nothing happens. I tried a different outlet and I even used my other power chord to make sure it wasn't that (I've had a previous issue with my chord shorting out after a power outage) and still nothing. I am really disappointed as I have trusted Corsair for 7 years now, my old PSU is the GS800 and is still chugging along like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Kenya Damian

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money, good way to start to build a gamer pc
customer_reviews.text: If you have a good PC gamer (1 video card) it is great, i do not know about two. One bad thing that I noticed is that the PCI connector (6+2 pins) having dual in a single cable doesn't help much connecting 1 into a motherboard and the other to the videocard. The separation of each plug in the cable is just to small to take advantage of the two connector in that same cable. They might have to work on this to get a little long distance. For all other things everything is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Octavio Navarro Llamas

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure what to say about this power supply, so I'll just tell you my experiences: 1) This model seems to work perfectly for my entry-level light-use desktop ATX PC. No problems, no weird noises. It just works. My PC is probably only pulling 175-200 watts max, so the 450 watt PSU gives me plenty of cushion. 2) This is my 2nd Corsair power supply. The other one is going strong after 3 years in another desktop. So, I think that means I like this product and Corsair PSU's in general.
customer_reviews.author: Sail Away

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Heed the warnings. These are junk. First one was DOA. Second one ran for less than a week. What happen to Corsair? These are junk.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Easy install and very quiet
customer_reviews.text: I bought this PSU to replace a Thermaltake unit that recently failed on my Linux machine. The Thermaltakes are highly rated and inexpensive, but I've had two failures in 3 years, so decided to try another brand. All I can say at this point (since I just installed it a few hours ago) is that it works fine and is extremely quiet. I have a large diameter/low velocity case fan and of course a CPU fan. I didn't realize until I installed this unit how noisy the old PSU fan was. That's all I've got for now. I'm hoping for more than the average 1.5 years I've gotten out of my previous units.
customer_reviews.author: William B. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Affordability and Reliability is the name of the game
customer_reviews.text: All the power you need and it doesn't break the bank. I am big fan of the Corsair cx series power supplies. They are affordable and reliable. I haven't had one quit on me yet and I love that they are modular. This power supply went into my new Ryzen 9 video editing PC build and it's doing great it's super quiet and the modular aspect allows me to keep my system looking clean. This is a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: My old Dell 7100 XPS Studio is back!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks to this perfect little power supply, I was able to revive my dying Computer with a very fair priced and more importantly "modular" PSU. Cable management is no longer an issue, and there is more than enough power to run my RIG 24/7 as it used to. It popped right into place, and is whisper quiet even when I push the PC as hard as I can. This is a great product at a great price. If you are not running a high powered gaming rig and are looking for something to upgrade your general use PC, this is the way to go!
customer_reviews.author: PuterGeek2

customer_reviews.title: Great budget PSU!
customer_reviews.text: This PSU is replacing a 3 year old CX500 psu. I needed a more powerful PSU since I bought an older GTX470 for an old rig I was "upgrading". The PSU has been running great and it's been running a bit cooler now that the CX500 isn't being pushed to it's very limit with the GTX470 sucking the life out of it haha. The CX550M does run cooler and thanks to the modular design my PC looks much cleaner.
customer_reviews.author: ClassicEndurance80

customer_reviews.title: Love it!! But...
customer_reviews.text: I only have one complaint about this model. Why do all of the GPU Power Cables have two connectors? I am going for the cleanest build possible, as this was my first, and now i have and extra 6 pin dangling. I guess i could invest in a cable that better fits my build, but there are two of these dual 6 pin cables in the box. I don't think this power supply warrants needing two of them as it is only 750 watts. msi - x570a-pro Ryzen - 3700x Crucial - 16 gig 3200 ddr4 msi - gtx1660
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: CX 750M, check your MB power connectors!
customer_reviews.text: My MB requires a 24 pin, 8 pin, and 4 pin. This product only has a single 4+4 cable, so I was forced to order another cable pack to get the necessary connector. (In some cases, you can use the first 4 pins of a 6+2 or 6 pin, my MB does not have room for the 6 pin to connect to the extra 4 pin connection. Overall however, the PSU is performing as expected, and was simple to install, just wish it had that extra 4 pin so I didn't have to waste time and money.
customer_reviews.author: A.H. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Great PSU.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great for the price. It's a good choice for any entry build gaming pc. It's Bronze Certified, has a small form factor, and while it's not modular at all it still doesn't have too many wires in excess. Would definitely recommend this to anyone looking to start a cheap build.
customer_reviews.author: UnholyV3nd3tta

customer_reviews.title: Quality/warranty/heavy duty capacitors
customer_reviews.text: A powerful PSU that will not kill your budget ...We know the history of Corsair the word Corsair is synonymous with quality components I Bought this several years ago ..Still going and it also has all the over protect from current and under protect from current Great high quality mesh cables very silent for a computer build that's in the medium range This would be perfect 650 powerful watts At a Bronze rating you cant go wrong
customer_reviews.author: unfulfilled techie

customer_reviews.title: Hats off to Corsair
customer_reviews.text: I got this unit as a replacement for the failing PC in my PC. Right off the bat, this thing is quiet! I had always assumed it was the case fans in my PC that was making all the noise. Nope, turns out it was the PSU. My PC is right next to my bed and I can sleep soundly at night. This was also my first time dealing with a modular PSU and I am never going back. It took me under 20 minutes to get this bad-boy installed. Overall, I'd highly recommend this PSU. The extra $10 or so for the modular version is when worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Power cord jiggles, causing shutoff
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a decent power supply. But Corsair includes a really bad power cord that won't stay in place. The PC kept shutting down randomly and I was about to return the power supply. While trying to figure out why, I noticed the jiggle in the power cord. Replaced the cord with one from an older PC and it appears to work fine now.
customer_reviews.author: CandyR

customer_reviews.title: Yes this item was burn and still sold it to me , am going to give one more try
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about building my new PC one I plug it in nothing happened checked my connection and everything was find , I knew the burn smell I felt when I was unboxing the item wasn't a good sing , I would say People please check items before selling to costumers , ohh pluss the box was open already the seal was not put on
customer_reviews.author: Leonel garrido

customer_reviews.title: Modular is GREAT
customer_reviews.text: This is a low cost unit to get modular design. The cables for the MB power and Video power are hard wired, but that is perfect. All the others are plug as-needed and that makes installation SO MUCH BETTER than having all the 'extra' cables stuffed in the back of the case somewhere. It does cost more than a fully cabled PS, BUT it's so much nicer. I would never go back to a non-modular PS after using this unit.
customer_reviews.author: BubbaDude

customer_reviews.title: Excellent replacement/upgrade to Dell OEM!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent power supply. Used it to swap out the oem supply with a Dell machine so I could put in a better graphic card. Exactly the same size as the stock power. Very easy to insert. Semi modular design allowed for only the necessary cables which saves a bit of space. Cables are well built and block so look much better than the stock though no window in case so does not matter much. Power switch on rear is a nice bonus. Overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Papoo Tech

customer_reviews.title: Totally recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: Product worked like charm, just wished that it would have come with more cables as there is only 1 modular cable with 3 molex connectors, 1 modular cable with 3 sata connectors and 1 modular cable with the connectors for the gpu. Aside from that i really liked the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jose A. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Held up great
customer_reviews.text: Have used this power supply for a number of months and it's held up just fine for my system. It's powering a Ryzen 5 1600x and RX 480, with 2 SSDs and an HDD. This was put together for before the great crypto currency spike in video card pricing, so that's been more than a year maybe more than two at this point I don't even remember but I'm happy to have gotten this power supply for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent modest-budget power supply. It's quiet. It comes with enough connectors. It's super reliable and delivers steady power. The ONE issue I've had with it comes from installing it in a full tower that has a lot of wire management: some of the power module cables are barely long enough. Just another inch or two would have made installation much easier. Still recommend.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Great no frills, but solid modular PSU, will definitely buy this series again
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a modular PSU for a small Linux build and this worked perfectly. I was building a board with only an NVMe drive and no GPU, so I really only needed the main preattached power cables. Voltages are within acceptable tolerances, the main cables are nicely sleeved, and I have zero complaints.
customer_reviews.author: l3bowsk1

customer_reviews.title: Simple install, works as it should
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a power supply that died in a computer that is several years old. The new power supply was a perfect fit, came with all the right wires and connectors. The semi-modular is ideal, and minimized clutter. Easy install, and it all powered up perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: MPC

customer_reviews.title: This PSU stop working at fourth month
customer_reviews.text: This PSU just work for less than four months, I bought it for my new PC, I built my new computer around January 2020, but starting april this PSU (Corsair CX Series 750 Watt 80+ Bronze Certified) stoped working, I am very disgusted with this, because I really like Corsair products and this PSU (it looks great at the PC with its black flat cables and it is very quiet), but based on this experience I am thinking about stop buying Corsair products. I had to install my old Thermaltake PSU (2014) due this problem.
customer_reviews.author: diego

customer_reviews.title: Audible Whining Sound (Edit: Whine Disappeared)
customer_reviews.text: The fan inside was contacting a plastic air channel, creating a maddening noise. The PSU was also producing an AC whining sound. So I unscrewed the fan, grate, and pressed down on the plastic. That fixed most of the noise. I am still disappointed. Edit: After about 1.5 weeks, the whine is gone and now I can hear the very loud fan when I'm on my desktop. Adding one star.
customer_reviews.author: CokeMonstrosity

customer_reviews.title: As good as it gets for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pros: great cables simple black and I love that. Really low fan noise. Perfect cable length fits all my cases even EATX and some itx. Cons: only one. When I installed the PSU I pulled on the cables to get a little more room and I broke the plastic bit were the cables come out. Still works I'm just dumb.
customer_reviews.author: J. Spanier

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough...
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I got a bad power supply, but it’s not working for me. I have troubles connecting to the USB...I don’t think my motherboard is the issue, for some reason the Corsair power supply feels as if it’s faulty. Perhaps I am unlucky...I had much hope for this...
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: I got two defective PSU's in a row
customer_reviews.text: I had very high hopes for this product. I have had good experiences with Corsair in the past. When the first power supply arrived I was very disappointed that it was defective. I understand though. Sometimes, you get a defective product. I asked amazon for a return, and they got one to me in an exceptionally fast time. I was thrilled. Then the second PSU was defective as well. This was not acceptable to me. I cannot accept two defective products in a row. I will likely try other Corsair products in the future, but I CANNOT recommend this unit. Best of luck to you all.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this if you're looking to dodge a mess of a psu.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. Runs fine in game, but dont you dare exit the game because this psu doesn't know how to function and reboots your computer three times. It even just reboots when I'm idling. And yes Ive troubleshooted, this psu is the problem. Will be returning this before it fries my pc.
customer_reviews.author: Anmar

customer_reviews.title: Good Price and it works
customer_reviews.text: choosing a power supply is one of the harder parts of a PC build. This doesn't break the bank and it works well. Only gripe is I wish these came with SATA power extenders as the multi tap cables are hard to use in a non drive bay set up. Extenders make it much easier. *Set up for 550watt PSU 16gb ddr4 (8x2) 3200mhz, AMD Ryzen 5 3600x, AMD Radeon RX 5600xt (Sapphire Pulse)
customer_reviews.author: dris

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this particular series, if you are set on a Corsair PSU for your build, grab a HX or AX series instead.
customer_reviews.text: died within 2 weeks. Already sent back for refund. If you are building a PC, do not cheap out on one of the most important pieces in your system! Go with a trusted, reliable power supply brand such as XFX, Seasonic, EVGA. Corsair power supplies are okay, Their AX and HX enthusiast series are some of the best! But this CX series cuts too many corners, and you will begin to see that within only a couple weeks of having owned one. More in depth, the problem is cheap taiwanese capacitors which have a repuation of being too cheap and failing, go for a power supply that is at least 80 gold rated, and has all japanese capacitors.
customer_reviews.author: Shane S.

customer_reviews.title: Exact replacement, fast
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to replace a failing PS in a custom build quickly. This was perfect. The original had turned in 6 years of nearly constant uptime when it started making some noise and giving off a slight burnt odor. This was delivered before it failed and required only an hour of downtime because every connection was identical.
customer_reviews.author: Chief Systems Engineer (Ret)

customer_reviews.title: Always buy Corsair products
customer_reviews.text: It's a Corsair! Never had any issues with Corsair produces and so this is performing as well as I expected. Nice quiet fan, easy installation. Hello Amazon readers from 3 years in the future. Yep, it's still working just fine. No idea why so many people posted about high failure rates, I've never had issues with Corsair stuff and this is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Chris HorryTop Contributor: Raspberry Pi

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing power supply for the price! but recommend its higher wattage version
customer_reviews.text: The power supply looked very sleek inside the computer once installed but it was difficult to install the power supply as the CPU and 12V connector would not click in and i would leave it as that (It was pretty snug in there. Also a bit of an advice, i recommend buying the 650W version of the power supply instead of the 550W, they are the same price and you get more wattage!
customer_reviews.author: Miguel L

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: First important note - unit is not completely modular. the motherboard and cpu connectors are hard wired to the power supply. Only the ATX connectors are modular. I installed the unit to replace a smaller EVGA power supply in a desktop that I was upgrading. Went to power up the computer and the power supply was DOA. After investing close to an hour troubleshooting the power supply with no success, replaced it with another similar unit which worked right out of the gate. I have been a strong proponent of Corsair hardware for years and was disappointed with this purchase experience. Thank you to Amazon for the customer friendly return process!
customer_reviews.author: Big John

customer_reviews.title: a good PSU
customer_reviews.text: This power supply is good over all. I haven't had many issues with it. Only thing I could nitpick about it would be the amount of ports it has but most likely you will have enough ports for what is actually needed.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni

customer_reviews.title: Does not include the +4 Pin if needed
customer_reviews.text: Typically 750W includes the standard pin connectors. Newer boards sometimes have the option for a +4 pin connector which this supply does not support. Manufacturer doesn't include this option until 800W options.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working as expected, time will tell, but Corsair is a solid brand
customer_reviews.text: Working exactly as expected, but the PSU is new so time will tell. However, I have always had good luck with Corsair and I another Bronze rated PSU that I have that's over 10 years old has worked without any issues. So I'm confident in this one as well.
customer_reviews.author: שון

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this (CX 750M)
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this PSU, my pc kept shutting down at least every hour, I tried swapping everything to find the issue (GPU, RGB fans, even the motherboard), and it never worked ok, my rig is a gtx 1070, i7 4790s so 750w should be more than enough. In the end I had to use my 6 year old Thermaltake 650w and it hasn't shud down once in a week.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Duque Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great option for a compact media PC.
customer_reviews.text: Installed easily into my mini ITX case. The modular cables made it very easy to fit the cables into a tight space. Plenty of power for my Ryzen 2400G. Started up 1st try. I've had zero problems with this in the 3 weeks it's been installed. Fairly quiet.
customer_reviews.author: srf

customer_reviews.title: Initially it worked fine but has since developed a buzzing/rattle in the fan
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for a few months now. Initially it worked fine but has since developed a buzzing/rattle in the fan. There is nothing caught in the fan and the room I have the computer in, is clean. If I turn the computer around and firmly tap the power supply with my finger or knuckle, the buzzing will stop. It is securely screwed in place; it's not a vibration of the whole unit, as it won't wiggle at all in the computer case. I'm dissapoointed for sure and past my return date.
customer_reviews.author: Eric J.

customer_reviews.title: Quiet
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice power supply only with it was partially modular. But all the cables could easily reach throughout my case while still keeping a nice and tidy build. I have it drawing air from under my case and exhausting it through the rear and it seems to keep cool with no issues
customer_reviews.author: Jake L.

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with a high end build!
customer_reviews.text: This power unit worked perfectly for my budget high end build. Would recommend 100%. Build Specs: MSI mpg z390 gaming edge ac (mystic light) i7-9700k Rotac 2070 Super Mini Cryorig H5 Ultimate Cooler 4 Arctic case fans. 2tb Crucial m.2 ssd 1tb HDD 7200 RPM
customer_reviews.author: Blase

customer_reviews.title: Saved Me
customer_reviews.text: My power surged one night during a bad storm. The complex was struck by lightning. Tried powering on my PC - it was dead. Luckily, this bad boy prevented the rest of the hardware from getting fried. BEAST
customer_reviews.author: Devin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget PSU
customer_reviews.text: Perfect PSU for my Dell Precision T1700 workstation (mini-tower). After installation (with the motherboard adapter - sold separately by a 3rd party) I was rockin' and rollin'. It's powerful and very capable. I installed a GeForce GTX 1050 TI graphics card and Samsung 860 EVO solid-state drive afterwards and my system is running like a new machine. Cost of a new computer - $1500.00+. Cost of PSU with adapter? less than $80.00.
customer_reviews.author: jb512

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet, Nice Cables
customer_reviews.text: I've had this PSU installed, in my stock ASUS case, which barely fit, for a few months, and have had 0 issues with it. It is tremendously quieter than the 500W one I installed that was upgraded from the 350W that came with the pc originally. I can barely hear my pc now and I can hear when my hhd is accessed, that's how quiet it is now. The cables that came with this PSU are much nicer than the ones that came with my last $50+ PSU. Modular makes things very clean. I don't require this much power yet, it was just one of the first upgrades I wanted to make, so hopefully all goes well.
customer_reviews.author: MakeCents

customer_reviews.title: Great PSU. Worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: This power supply is amazing. Used it in my 2200g build. Pros: -Easy to install -Reliable -Modular Cons: -Occasionally makes a strange buzzing sound. I hear it about once or twice a day, and it lasts for maybe 4 seconds -CPU power and 24 pin ATX cords are stiff. My case doesn't have a huge side panel for cables, and these were not flexible and weak like they should be, and were kinda thick too.
customer_reviews.author: Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: Don’t go too cheap on a power supply. Also don’t get just enough for your current build. This is a good quality buy that can handle future expansion. Comes with a good amount of options for different needs. Easy implementation into PC. Works well. Would purchase again
customer_reviews.author: Parker Family

customer_reviews.title: Powers two Graphics cards and 5 hard drives just fine
customer_reviews.text: The modular system for this price is great. You can just remove the un- needed cables from your system to free up cludder. If you are going for an asthetic built PC, you need the extra space for custom cables and keeping it clean. Here is a picture of my system :)
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Serious quality issues. They need to pay attention.
customer_reviews.text: They seriously have to pay attention to how they manufacture. The power cords do not fit at all until you use some tool to widen the holes. And there's not enough lines for the ati power. I had to return this and get evga and day and night hwo the build and quality is almost for very comparable price. Write better manuals too.
customer_reviews.author: TonyP

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient and worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: For my first PC Build I was recommended to give this Power Unit a try, for the most part it does the job well and installation is a breeze to do. The labels on the chords really help with newcomers so you'll do just fine with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rhyto

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of the cheap wiring and connectors
customer_reviews.text: It's been a while since I've purchased a power supply but the wiring on this thing seems rather flimsy, and, since it's not color coded, you have no chance of checking the configuration. It makes you wonder about the quality of the rest of the unit. The CX550M is not expensive, but it's also not cheap. With that said, it works. Let's see how long it last.
customer_reviews.author: Hooked on Books

customer_reviews.title: no issues
customer_reviews.text: fine power source dont have to think about it so its good. no issues.
customer_reviews.author: CadetBird

customer_reviews.title: Quiet.  Keeps things powered.  What more do you need?
customer_reviews.text: running i5-9600k (95w), RTX 2070S, Aorus pro wifi. No OC yet. The only thing I can really say against it is that the wires arent as tight as they could be, especially the extra PCIe 2x2 that is needed for more powerful cards. Creates a bit of a loop that is visibly odd.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Holden

customer_reviews.title: super super quiet I really like the flat cables and ...
customer_reviews.text: lots has been written here already, so I'll just skip to a couple key notes. super super quiet I really like the flat cables and the fact that they're all black, just wish there were more options. to keep things clean and or reach different combinations of components the mobo power cables are a tad bit long, but that's mostly because i've got mine in a mini-atx case, so a standard ATX case won't have any problems. I've only had it up and running for 4 days so far, but if i run in to any issues with it I'll be sure to update this review.
customer_reviews.author: IIIMik3

product_meta.title: Corsair CX Series 650 Watt 80 Plus Bronze Certified Modular Power Supply (CP-9020103-NA)
product_meta.description: Color:80+ Bronze| Size:650 Watts| Style:CX-M, Semi-Modular| Pattern Name:Power SupplyCX Series Modular power supply units are an excellent choice for basic system builds and desktop PC computer upgrades, offering high reliability, low noise, and easy installation. The flexible modular cabling system lets you use only the cables you need, and 80 PLUS Bronze certified efficiency means less excess heat, lower noise, and lower power bills. The large diameter, thermally controlled fan makes the CX Series Modular quieter at idle, and reduces noise even when you're pushing your system hard. The matte black finish, black sleeved cables and black connectors help give your system a restrained, high tech look.
feature_bullets: 80 PLUS Bronze certified: High efficiency operation for less excess heat and lower operating costs
Thermally controlled Fan: Silent operation at low and medium loads; MTBF hours: 100,000 hours
Semi modular: Make your builds and upgrades easy, with clean, great looking results
Five year warranty: Your guarantee of reliable operation that will last across several system builds
Continuous output rated temperature is 40 degree Celsius. Fan size-4.7 inch

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars5,698 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
